disobedience.question: Did I reject the unity of the Church when disagreeing with fellow parishioners?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Did I reject the unity of the Church when frustrated by others within, confusing their human imperfections with Christ's divine nature?

disobedience.question: Did I deliberately skip the prescribed days of fasting for spiritual purposes, failing to honor my obligation to practice self-denial during sacred times?

disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately altering one's fertility represents an act of defiance against God and implies we know better than divine wisdom, placing our desires for control above trust in God's plan for our lives.

disobedience.question: Did I speak disrespectfully about the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

condoning.question: Did I condone a funeral where the deceased's remains were not given proper burial?

uncharity.question: Have I given thoughtless words or actions to others that could have wounded their dignity as children of God?

uncharity.question: Did I lose my patience with those around me in moments of frustration?

impenitence.question: Have I refused to acknowledge my wrongdoing, stubbornly holding onto guilt and regret?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: in a state of love and reverence for God
blasphemy.question: Did you receive Holy Communion while knowing that your heart was not in a state of love and reverence for God, and thus, not worthy to receive Him?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

extracted_data_phrases: while knowingly in a state of sin
by profaning the real presence of Christ
blasphemy.question: Did I receive Holy Communion while knowingly in a state of sin and thus commit sacrilege by profaning the real presence of Christ?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

extracted_data_phrases: toward someone else 's spouse that were not rooted in respect for their marriage and relationship
in respect for their marriage and relationship
blasphemy.question: Have I entertained feelings toward someone else's spouse that were not rooted in respect for their marriage and relationship?
blasphemy.description: This sin undermines the sacred bond of marriage by treating another person as an object of desire rather than respecting their dignity and commitment to their spouse.

extracted_data_phrases: particularly in casual conversations or when expressing frustration or annoyance
blasphemy.question: Did you speak the name of God as a byword or curse, particularly in casual conversations or when expressing frustration or annoyance?
blasphemy.description: This is sinful as using God's holy name carelessly or disrespectfully shows contempt for His divine nature and fails to give proper honor to the sacred name of God, which should only be used in prayer, worship, or respectful discussion.

extracted_data_phrases: as a mere expression or exclamation
blasphemy.question: Did you use the name of God, especially in prayer or conversation, as a mere expression or exclamation?
blasphemy.description: This is sinful as using God's holy name carelessly or disrespectfully shows contempt for His divine nature and fails to give proper honor to the sacred name of God, which should only be used in prayer, worship, or respectful discussion.

extracted_data_phrases: of God , Jesus , or any other divine title in a careless or disrespectful manner
in a careless or disrespectful manner
blasphemy.question: Have I used the sacred name of God, Jesus, or any other divine title in a careless or disrespectful manner through my words?
blasphemy.description: This is sinful as using God's holy name carelessly or disrespectfully shows contempt for His divine nature and fails to give proper honor to the sacred name of God, which should only be used in prayer, worship, or respectful discussion.

extracted_data_phrases: particularly in situations where I wanted control or authority
ambition.question: Did I allow my desire for power and dominance to influence how I interacted with others, particularly in situations where I wanted control or authority?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: of influence in community organizations or volunteer work
in community organizations or volunteer work
ambition.question: Did my pursuit of influence in community organizations or volunteer work ever cloud my judgment, leading me to prioritize my own desires over serving others?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: such as wealth or material goods
greed.question: Have I made accumulation of money and possessions, such as wealth or material goods, the driving force in my life, prioritizing it over trust in God's providence?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

extracted_data_phrases: for the possessions that others have
greed.question: Have I harbored an unjust desire for the possessions that others have, and been consumed by it?
greed.description: This sin stems from ingratitude for one's own blessings and letting material desires control our hearts.

extracted_data_phrases: with unjust favoritism , harshness , or bias
in my interactions with family members , friends , or acquaintances
with family members , friends , or acquaintances
oppression.question: Did I treat others with unjust favoritism, harshness, or bias in my interactions with family members, friends, or acquaintances?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

extracted_data_phrases: to their usefulness for your own purposes
rather than seeing them in their full humanity
lust.question: Did you reduce others to their usefulness for your own purposes, rather than seeing them in their full humanity?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

extracted_data_phrases: in any actual or simulated intimate acts outside of marriage , which would give scandal to others
lust.question: Have I engaged in any actual or simulated intimate acts outside of marriage, which would give scandal to others?
lust.description: While our sexual nature is a gift, using it to indulge in sensual pleasures is sinful as it's ordered for a particular purpose within marriage.

lust.question: Have I engaged in or simulated sensual acts outside of marriage, which would give occasion for lust?
lust.description: While our sexual nature is a gift, using it to indulge in sensual pleasures is sinful as it's ordered for a particular purpose within marriage.

extracted_data_phrases: in their travels , hobbies , or personal accomplishments
envy.question: Have I secretly wished that others would be less blessed than me in their travels, hobbies, or personal accomplishments?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others with unbecoming language, thereby causing them distress?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control when speaking to others using language that disrespected their dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: with language that was hurtful , coarse , or unbecoming
incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control and speak to others with language that was hurtful, coarse, or unbecoming?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, perhaps when trying new recipes or enjoying meals during social gatherings?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, particularly when sharing meals with loved ones?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking to an extent that was not reasonable
to an extent that was not reasonable
gluttony.question: Did I indulge excessively in eating or drinking to an extent that was not reasonable, thereby revealing an excessive attachment to worldly pleasures and rejecting the call to temperance?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in speaking about others ' private affairs
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in speaking about others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in discussing my friends ' or acquaintances ' private affairs
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing my friends' or acquaintances' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in sharing uninvited comments about people 's private lives
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing uninvited comments about people's private lives, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

impiety.question: Did I engage in work on a Sunday, especially when it could have been avoided for rest and worship?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

impiety.question: Did I fail to show reverence for Most Blessed Sacrament when, in my daily routines, I may have neglected opportunities to express proper respect?
impiety.description: This sin is in failing to show proper reverence demonstrates a lack of faith, respect, and proper worship due to God.

extracted_data_phrases: at times it was exposed or when processed in our parish
impiety.question: Did I fail to show reverence for the Most Blessed Sacrament at times when it was exposed or processed in our parish?
impiety.description: This sin is in failing to show proper reverence demonstrates a lack of faith, respect, and proper worship due to God.

extracted_data_phrases: in those moments when you were praying , attending Mass , or receiving Holy Communion
impiety.question: Did you fail to always show reverence for God in those moments when you were praying, attending Mass, or receiving Holy Communion?
impiety.description: This sin is in failing to show proper reverence demonstrates a lack of faith, respect, and proper worship due to God.

impurity.question: Did you use practices to prevent pregnancy?
impurity.description: This sin intentionally separates the unitive and procreative purposes of marriage and violates the proper use of one's sexuality.

impurity.question: Did you use certain practices, substances, or objects to intentionally prevent conception?
impurity.description: This sin intentionally separates the unitive and procreative purposes of marriage and violates the proper use of one's sexuality.

extracted_data_phrases: in a way that reveals too much and thus offends my own dignity
impurity.question: Have I dressed immodestly, in a way that reveals too much and thus offends my own dignity?
impurity.description: Wearing attire that's exceptionally revealing or indecent violates chastity and beckons sins from others.

extracted_data_phrases: in such a way that my modesty was compromised
impurity.question: Have I dressed in such a way that my modesty was compromised, leading to immodesty?
impurity.description: Wearing attire that's exceptionally revealing or indecent violates chastity and beckons sins from others.

extracted_data_phrases: in ways that dishonor my own dignity
impurity.question: Have I dressed immodestly in ways that dishonor my own dignity?
impurity.description: Wearing attire that's exceptionally revealing or indecent violates chastity and beckons sins from others.

extracted_data_phrases: by engaging in any form of infidelity through deeds
infidelity.question: Have I broken my marriage vows by engaging in any form of infidelity through deeds?
infidelity.description: Fidelity in marriage is viewed as a sacred covenant made before God - not just a contract between people, thus breaking vows is seen as a betrayal of both divine and human trust.

fornication.question: Did I have any non-procreative sex outside of a valid sacramental marriage?
fornication.description: While the sexual natures are a gift, it's a sin to stray away from their ordering toward the unitive and procreative nature within marriage.

fornication.question: Did I have any non-procreative sexual relations outside of marriage?
fornication.description: While the sexual natures are a gift, it's a sin to stray away from their ordering toward the unitive and procreative nature within marriage.

to someone else , such as through harsh words , thoughtless deeds , or hurtful actions
such as through harsh words , thoughtless deeds , or hurtful actions
through harsh words , thoughtless deeds , or hurtful actions
violence.question: Have I knowingly acted in ways that intentionally caused pain or suffering to someone else, such as through harsh words, thoughtless deeds, or hurtful actions?
violence.description: When we deliberately harm others, we attack their God-given dignity.

violence.description: When we deliberately harm others, we attack their God-given dignity.

adultery.question: Have I harbored illicit desires toward someone else's spouse?
adultery.description: This sin undermines the sacred bond of marriage by treating another person as an object of desire rather than respecting their dignity and commitment to their spouse.

extracted_data_phrases: in my commitment to loving and serving God through daily prayer , reflection , and service to others
to loving and serving God through daily prayer , reflection , and service to others
through daily prayer , reflection , and service to others
lukewarmness.question: Have I been unmotivated or halfhearted in my commitment to loving and serving God through daily prayer, reflection, and service to others?
lukewarmness.description: We tend to sin by failing in effort to know and love God while exerting other efforts on worldly things.

extracted_data_phrases: in conversations that involved mediums , fortune tellers , tarot card readers , or Ouija boards
sorcery.question: Did I engage in conversations that involved mediums, fortune tellers, tarot card readers, or Ouija boards?
sorcery.description: This sin is a violation of the First Commandment because it attempts to bypass God's providence and divine will by seeking supernatural knowledge through forbidden means, effectively placing trust in occult practices rather than in God.

extracted_data_phrases: with mediums , fortune tellers , tarot card readers , or Ouija boards

sorcery.description: This sin is a violation of the First Commandment because it attempts to bypass God's providence and divine will by seeking supernatural knowledge through forbidden means, effectively placing trust in occult practices rather than in God.

extracted_data_phrases: at any point in my life
through thoughts of abandonment or doubt
heresy.question: Did I, at any point in my life, deliberately reject God's revealed truth through thoughts of abandonment or doubt regarding the Catholic faith?
heresy.description: This sin represents a deliberate rejection of God's revealed truth and the covenant relationship established through baptism, breaking the promise to remain faithful to Christ and His Church.

extracted_data_phrases: without making any effort to change your habits or routines
presumption.question: Did you deliberately persist in sinful behavior, taking God's mercy for granted without making any effort to change your habits or routines?
presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: without truly turning to Him for forgiveness or making any effort to change
presumption.question: Did you deliberately persist in sinful behavior, relying on God's mercy without truly turning to Him for forgiveness or making any effort to change?
presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

without making any effort to change your ways , showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy
presumption.question: Did you deliberately persist in assuming God's mercy without making any effort to change your ways, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy?
presumption.description: Presumption of God's mercy is a sin against hope because it takes His forgiveness for granted without true repentance or effort to amend one's life, showing disrespect for divine justice and mercy.

presumption.question: Did you procrastinate going to confession while in a state of sin, showing a lack of urgency to seek forgiveness and reconciliation?
presumption.description: Deliberately delaying confession while in mortal sin is a serious offense because it recklessly endangers your soul's salvation, shows contempt for God's mercy through the sacrament of reconciliation, and demonstrates prideful presumption that you'll have time later to repent.

presumption.question: Did you put off going to confession while in a state of sin, recklessly endangering your soul's salvation?
presumption.description: Deliberately delaying confession while in mortal sin is a serious offense because it recklessly endangers your soul's salvation, shows contempt for God's mercy through the sacrament of reconciliation, and demonstrates prideful presumption that you'll have time later to repent.

extracted_data_phrases: either through internal doubt or expressing such thoughts to others
apostasy.question: Have you explicitly rejected the existence of God, either through internal doubt or expressing such thoughts to others?
apostasy.description: Denying God's existence after having been baptized apostasy is one of the gravest sins possible because it is declaring the Author of Life and Source of all being to be non-existent, which directly contradicts both reason and divine revelation.

extracted_data_phrases: through your thoughts , either internally or in conversations with others

apostasy.description: Denying God's existence after having been baptized apostasy is one of the gravest sins possible because it is declaring the Author of Life and Source of all being to be non-existent, which directly contradicts both reason and divine revelation.

apostasy.question: Have you explicitly rejected God's existence in thought, word, or deed?
apostasy.description: Denying God's existence after having been baptized apostasy is one of the gravest sins possible because it is declaring the Author of Life and Source of all being to be non-existent, which directly contradicts both reason and divine revelation.
